results.title: I May Destroy You
results.creator_credit: Various Artists Limited, FALKNA Productions, Simon Maloney, Simon Meyers, Paul Cross and Lynsey Moore
results.brief_description: Set in London, where gratification is only an app away, the story centers on Arabella, a carefree, self-assured Londoner with a group of great friends, a boyfriend in Italy, and a burgeoning writing career. But when her drink is spiked, she must question and rebuild every element of her life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Various Artists Limited, FALKNA Productions, Simon Maloney, Simon Meyers, Paul Cross and Lynsey Moore
results.description: Set in London, where gratification is only an app away, the story centers on Arabella, a carefree, self-assured Londoner with a group of great friends, a boyfriend in Italy, and a burgeoning writing career. But when her drink is spiked, she must question and rebuild every element of her life.

But when her drink is spiked, she must question and rebuild every element of her life.

video_links.name: I May Destroy You: Trailer - BBC

results.title: I Am Not Your Negro
results.creator_credit: James Baldwin, Velvet Film, Independent Lens, RTBF, ARTE, Shelter Prod, RTS and Raoul Peck
results.headline_credit: Belgium, France and United States of America, 2017
results.brief_description: Working from the text of James Baldwin’s unfinished final novel, director Raoul Peck creates a meditation on what it means to be Black in the United States.

constellations_other.name: MLK/FBI: blackness In America
constellations_other.description: Award-winning documentarian Sam Pollard looks at J. Edgar Hoover and the FBI’s pursuit of Martin Luther King Jr in the lead-up to his assassination during America’s Civil Rights Movement of the sixties.

constellations_other.name: My Hometown: Archives woven into new narrative
constellations_other.description: Offering viewers a snapshot of life on the road for an Australian touring band in the 1960s, 'My Hometown', directed by Sari Braithwaite was developed reimagining archival 8mm footage shot by drummer Leon Isackson.

results.creator_credit_for_label: James Baldwin, Velvet Film, Independent Lens, RTBF, ARTE, Shelter Prod, RTS and Raoul Peck
results.headline_credit_for_label: Belgium, France and United States of America, 2017
results.description: Working from the text of James Baldwin’s unfinished final novel, director Raoul Peck creates a meditation on what it means to be Black in the United States.
description_for_label: Working from the text of James Baldwin’s unfinished final novel, director Raoul Peck creates a meditation on what it means to be Black in the United States.

video_links.name: I Am Not Your Negro - Official Trailer

results.title: I'll Be Gone in the Dark
results.creator_credit: HBO Documentary Films, Story Syndicate, Susan Alegria, Amber Unkle, Kate Barry and Elizabeth Wolff
results.brief_description: An exploration of the case of the Golden State Killer who terrorized California in the 1970s and 1980s, committing 50 sexual assaults and 10 murders, and true crime author Michelle McNamara’s obsessive quest to find justice on behalf of his victims.

constellations_other.name: Reasonable doubt
constellations_other.description: Factual media has the power to reframe information and put forth new, persuasive arguments.  For the criminal justice system, where convictions are made based on arguments being convincing beyond a reasonable doubt, True Crime media has the ability to create doubt, right the wrongs of the justice system, and shed new light on closed cases.

constellations_other.name: Assassins: real world manifestations
constellations_other.description: Ryan White’s documentary Assassins breaks down the wild true story of the assassination of North Korea’s Kim John-nam, diving into the political and personal motivations behind the event.

results.creator_credit_for_label: HBO Documentary Films, Story Syndicate, Susan Alegria, Amber Unkle, Kate Barry and Elizabeth Wolff
results.description: An exploration of the case of the Golden State Killer who terrorized California in the 1970s and 1980s, committing 50 sexual assaults and 10 murders, and true crime author Michelle McNamara’s obsessive quest to find justice on behalf of his victims.
description_for_label: An exploration of the case of the Golden State Killer who terrorized California in the 1970s and 1980s, committing 50 sexual assaults and 10 murders, and true crime author Michelle McNamara’s obsessive quest to find justice on behalf of his victims.

video_links.name: I'll Be Gone In the Dark (2020): Official Trailer | HBO

results.title: HyperNormalisation
results.creator_credit: BBC, Adam Curtis and Sandra Gorel
results.brief_description: HyperNormalisation is a 2016 BBC documentary by British filmmaker Adam Curtis. It argues that governments, financiers, and technological utopians have, since the 1970s, given up on the complex “real world” and built a simpler “fake world” run by corporations and kept stable by politicians.

constellations_other.name: Copy, transform and combine
constellations_other.description: You will see me (2020) repurposes material sourced from the history of the moving image – archival footage, news, interviews, documentaries, reality TV, video diaries and social media – to reflect on the way we perform in front of and reveal ourselves to the camera.

results.description: We live in a world where the powerful deceive us. We know they lie. They know we know they lie. They do not care. We say we care, but we do nothing, and nothing ever changes. It is normal. Welcome to the post-truth world. How we got to where we are now…
description_for_label: We live in a world where the powerful deceive us. We know they lie. They know we know they lie. They do not care. We say we care, but we do nothing, and nothing ever changes. It is normal. Welcome to the post-truth world. How we got to where we are now…

results.title: Hustlers
results.creator_credit: Lorene Scafaria, Jessica Pressler, Adam McKay and Nuyorican Productions
results.brief_description: A crew of savvy former strip club employees band together to turn the tables on their Wall Street clients.

constellations_other.name: Crime doesn't pay
constellations_other.description: Ned Kelly's famous armour has appeared in many films, but the criminal myth speaks to how audiences have always been captivated by true-crime stories, from the beginning of cinema to today.

constellations_other.name: Ladies who own the narrative
constellations_other.description: Despite the lag in making it in mainstream cinema, female action heroes can actually be traced back to the late 19th century in early magic lantern performances of Jane Conquest, who saved both her child and a ship full of men.

constellations_other.name: Aquaman VFX
constellations_other.description: As well as becoming a global box-office sensation, Aquaman (2018) featured groundbreaking visual effects from Australian companies such as Method Studios.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Lorene Scafaria, Jessica Pressler, Adam McKay and Nuyorican Productions
results.description: A crew of savvy former strip club employees band together to turn the tables on their Wall Street clients.
description_for_label: A crew of savvy former strip club employees band together to turn the tables on their Wall Street clients.

results.title: Hunt for the Wilderpeople
results.brief_description: Ricky is a defiant young city kid who finds himself on the run with his cantankerous foster uncle in the wild New Zealand bush. A national manhunt ensues, and the two are forced to put aside their differences and work together to survive.

constellations_other.name: Native Tongue
constellations_other.description: The lead single off her album of the same name, 'Native Tongue' saw artist Mo'Ju explore cultural identity through music, movement and striking visuals.

results.description: Ricky is a defiant young city kid who finds himself on the run with his cantankerous foster uncle in the wild New Zealand bush. A national manhunt ensues, and the two are forced to put aside their differences and work together to survive.

results.title: Human Flow
results.headline_credit: Germany and United States of America, 2017
results.brief_description: More than 65 million people around the world have been forced from their homes to escape famine, climate change and war, the greatest displacement since World War II. Filmmaker Ai Weiwei examines the staggering scale of the refugee crisis and its profoundly personal human impact.

constellations_other.name: Seeking asylum
constellations_other.description: Chauka Please Tell Us the Time was covertly filmed on a smartphone inside the Manus Island Detention Centre and sent via WhatsApp.

results.description: More than 65 million people around the world have been forced from their homes to escape famine, climate change and war, the greatest displacement since World War II. Filmmaker Ai Weiwei examines the staggering scale of the refugee crisis and its profoundly personal human impact. Over the course of one year in 23 countries, Weiwei follows a chain of urgent human stories that stretch across the globe, including Afghanistan, France, Greece, Germany and Iraq.
description_for_label: More than 65 million people around the world have been forced from their homes to escape famine, climate change and war, the greatest displacement since World War II. Filmmaker Ai Weiwei examines the staggering scale of the refugee crisis and its profoundly personal human impact. Over the course of one year in 23 countries, Weiwei follows a chain of urgent human stories that stretch across the globe, including Afghanistan, France, Greece, Germany and Iraq.

video_links.name: Human Flow Official Trailer [HD] | Amazon Studios

results.title: Howl's Moving Castle
results.creator_credit: d-rights, Tokuma Shoten, Tohokushinsha Film Corporation (TFC), Studio Ghibli, Mitsubishi, DENTSU Music And Entertainment, Buena Vista Home Entertainment, Nippon Television Network Corporation, Hayao Miyazaki, Tomohiko Ishii, Rick Dempsey, Ned Lott, Toshio Suzuki and Tohokushinsha Film Corporation
results.brief_description: When Sophie, a shy young woman, is cursed with an old body by a spiteful witch, her only chance of breaking the spell lies with a self-indulgent yet insecure young wizard and his companions in his legged, walking castle.
results.creator_credit_for_label: d-rights, Tokuma Shoten, Tohokushinsha Film Corporation (TFC), Studio Ghibli, Mitsubishi, DENTSU Music And Entertainment, Buena Vista Home Entertainment, Nippon Television Network Corporation, Hayao Miyazaki, Tomohiko Ishii, Rick Dempsey, Ned Lott, Toshio Suzuki and Tohokushinsha Film Corporation
results.description: When Sophie, a shy young woman, is cursed with an old body by a spiteful witch, her only chance of breaking the spell lies with a self-indulgent yet insecure young wizard and his companions in his legged, walking castle.

results.title: How to Talk to Girls at Parties
results.creator_credit: Neil Gaiman, Helen Scott and Little Punk
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2017
results.brief_description: Croydon, 1977. A trio of punk teenagers goes to a party to meet girls, but they find that girls there are very different from what they expected.

constellations_other.name: Sci-fi, surrealism and strangeness
constellations_other.description: Step through Portal 2 to explore the links between its sci-fi comedy and the world of film and TV.

results.title: How to Let Go of the World and Love All the Things Climate Can't Change
results.brief_description: When documentarian Josh Fox realises that the answers for how to respond to the degradation of our environment cannot be found in his own back yard, he travels the world to connect with communities that are already facing grave effects of climate change.

constellations_other.name: Freedom from surveillance
constellations_other.description: Real world and cinematic authoritarianism and resistance explored through documentaries, Hollywood blockbusters, TV and videogames.

results.title_for_label: How to Let Go of the World and Love All the Things Climate Can’t Change
results.description: When documentarian Josh Fox realizes, after much soul searching, that the answers for how to respond to the degradation of our environment cannot be found in his own back yard, he travels the world to connect with communities that are already facing grave effects of climate change. What he finds is a complicated mix of tragedy and inspiration in the various ways climate change is affecting our value systems. How to Let Go of the World delivers a sobering portrait of the state of climate change, and takes stock of what makes humans survivors, and our societies so creative and resilient.
description_for_label: When documentarian Josh Fox realizes, after much soul searching, that the answers for how to respond to the degradation of our environment cannot be found in his own back yard, he travels the world to connect with communities that are already facing grave effects of climate change. What he finds is a complicated mix of tragedy and inspiration in the various ways climate change is affecting our value systems. How to Let Go of the World delivers a sobering portrait of the state of climate change, and takes stock of what makes humans survivors, and our societies so creative and resilient.
